steps.title: Cut through the band where it sits on one of the slingshot’s arms.
steps.content: Cut through the band where it sits on one of the slingshot’s arms. Use a sharp knife to make a vertical cut where the band sits on the vertical part of the slingshot’s metal arm. Slice the band horizontally where it sits on the horizontal tip of the arm. [1] X Research source Try to cut just deep enough to slice through the slingshot band without scratching the metal arm underneath it. A pocket knife with a serrated blade works well for this, but you can use any sharp blade you have available. For example, an X-ACTO knife or a boxcutter would also work.

steps.title: Pull the old band off one side of the slingshot.
steps.content: Pull the old band off one side of the slingshot. Hold the slingshot firmly in one hand. Use your other hand to pull the sliced band off the arm of the slingshot. [2] X Research source You don’t have to be gentle or try to preserve the band in any way. Just pull and tear the band off the arm.

steps.title: Repeat the process for the other side of the band.
steps.content: Repeat the process for the other side of the band. Slice through the band where it sits on the other arm of the slingshot. Rip it off the arm and discard it. [3] X Research source If you haven’t bought a replacement band yet, you can keep the old band to use as a reference when you’re shopping for a new one, if you want the same style of band.

steps.title: Purchase a replacement slingshot band that fits your slingshot.
steps.content: Purchase a replacement slingshot band that fits your slingshot. Visit a sporting goods store or search online using keywords like "slingshot replacement band" to find a new band. Buy the band at the store or order it online when you find one that you like. Slingshot bands come in standard sizes that fit most slingshots. A normal band will cost you about $5 USD, while something like a high-velocity band can cost around $10.

steps.title: Pour about 1 in (2.5 cm) of isopropyl alcohol into a cup.
steps.content: Pour about 1 in (2.5 cm) of isopropyl alcohol into a cup. Open up a bottle of isopropyl alcohol and pour it in a cup or mug. The alcohol is for lubricating the slingshot arms, so that you can actually slide the new band onto them. [4] X Research source Isopropyl alcohol is the recommended lubricant for this process because it is slippery enought to let you slide the band onto the arms, but will evaporate and dry up quickly, leaving the band securely attached to the arms. The higher the percentage of the alcohol, the faster it will dry after you put your new band on your slingshot. Use at least 70%-strength isopropyl alcohol. Use 90-99%-strength alcohol for the best results, if you can find it.

steps.title: Dip one slingshot arm into the cup of alcohol.
steps.content: Dip one slingshot arm into the cup of alcohol. Plunge the arm on one side of the slingshot all the way to the bottom of the cup. Swirl it around in the alcohol for a second. [5] X Research source You can also splash some rubbing alcohol in your hand and rub it onto the slingshot arms.

steps.title: Push one side of the new band all the way onto the lubricated arm.
steps.content: Push one side of the new band all the way onto the lubricated arm. Slide the band all the way onto the horizontal tip of the arm. Pull it down the vertical part of the arm as far as it will go. [6] X Research source Work fast after you lubricate the slingshot arm, so that the alcohol doesn’t drip off or dry up before you can get the band on.

steps.title: Repeat the process for the other side of the slingshot.
steps.content: Repeat the process for the other side of the slingshot. Dip the other arm of the slingshot into the cup full of alcohol to lubricate it. Push and slide the other side of the slingshot band all the way onto the arm until it won’t go any further. [7] X Research source It’s important to put the band all the way on the arms, past the bend in the arms, so that it will stay on securely when you use the slingshot. Don’t ever just slide the band onto the tips of the arms.

steps.title: Wait 24 hours before you use the slingshot.
steps.content: Wait 24 hours before you use the slingshot. This allows all of the alcohol to evaporate and dry up. The new band will be firmly stuck onto the slingshot’s arms after this. [8] X Research source
